channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024040610
item.description:
Report E-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote while at the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred into a new poly tote and then provided to the customer. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with all spent absorbent pads. The waste removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041332
item.description:
Report X-2024041332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: PHARR
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/22/24 at approximatley 1030, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 234501 at the staion location in Pharr, TX, reporting a corrosive liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 4 glass bottles and 1 plastic bottle inside of a fiberboard box. Each glass bottle held 1 liter of corrosive liquid and the plastic bottle held approximately 6 ounces of the same liquid. 2 of the 4 glass bottles were discovered to have sustained damage to the body, resulting in spillage. The cause the damage is unknown. The damaged inner containers were placed in a salvage drum for disposal and the unharried inner containers were isolated and awaits pick-up by the customer.

item.title: Report E-2024040529
item.description:
Report E-2024040529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due improper loading of the freight that resulted in one (1) 15-gallon plastic jug to overturn and leak. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard and plastic wrap. The 15-gallon plastic jug was inspected, and no damage was observed. The jugs bung was tightened and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040475
item.description:
Report E-2024040475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While offloading a shipment at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Baytown, TX, it was discovered that there were a few pallets with three drums on them loaded into the truck at the shipper's location. As a result one drum was not completely blocked in and toppled over during transit. Material leaked from the bung hole onto the trailer floor. Before picking up the drum to its upright position, the bung was tightened to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040974
item.description:
Report X-2024040974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from bottom of trailer 824248. when PH lifted package, he noticed it was wet. QA immediately took package, o0pened it and found that 1 plastic jug had a small puncture in the handle and had released approx. 8 ounces into the box. The box appeared to have absorbed all the released liquid, none was found in the trailer. Box was placed in HAZMAT recovery bucket and processed. DescribePack: Plastic jug had a small pin in the seam on the handle, and the seal was punctured. Unable to determine the cause of the failure. There was absolutely no damage to outer packing or other jugs. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leaking jug was placed in Hazmat bucket lined with plastic bag and absorb all material in the bottom.

item.description:

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found near a load door wet and torn. 3 of the bottles were outside of the box. 2 were missing their caps. DescribePack: 1 bottle was half empty and another was 80% empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Bottles were sitting upright when found. Leakage was not spreading. Box and bottles were placed in a salvage drum, then moved to the Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040833
item.description:
Report X-2024040833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package went up the overhead conveyor belt and got damaged. Then the package was taken to QA when a package handlers realize it was damaged DescribePack: The box is completely wet and is missing a side. One bottle had a crack near the handle and is now empty. Another bottle had a loose cap and is now half empty. The remaining two bottles are still in good shipping condition. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handler placed the package in a bag. Then they place it in a black tub to prevent the corrosive liquid from spreading.
